newsitem.title: UK: Investors seen backing EMAP oustings-paper.
newsitem.headline: Investors seen backing EMAP oustings-paper.

text.p: Institutional shareholders in EMAP are expected to support plans by the UK media company to oust two non-executive directors, but some are pressing for replacements, the Financial Times said.
A majority of EMAP's shareholders are likely to support the company's plan to remove Professor Ken Simmonds and Joe Cooke at an extraordinary meeting on Monday, the paper said.
Some shareholders want new non-executives appointed immediately to help decide who will replace Sir John Hoskyns when he retires as chairman in 1998.
The newspaper said EMAP would not comment ahead of the meeting but, privately, executives said the requests by shareholders were being seriously considered.
